summary: As much as I know Sansa is gonna be annoyed with Jon when he returns from bending the knee I just want her to force him to shut...
body: As much as I know Sansa is gonna be annoyed with Jon when he returns from bending the knee I just want her to force him to shut up and play scattergories cause he’s missed months of stark family game night and her and Arya are tired of losing to Bran cause he keeps cheating with his all knowingness.

blog.name: maisiestyle
blog.title: Maisie Williams | Arya Stark | Styles & Musings

summary:
CCXP: Arya Stark’s final season of Game of Thrones will be reminiscent of her Season 1 story arc.
 Question: What is the main...
caption:
CCXP: Arya Stark’s final season of Game of Thrones will be reminiscent of her Season 1 story arc.

Question: What is the main theme of Arya and Sam’s journey towards the end of the show?

Maisie Williams: In my case, Arya has a development that has a lot of reminiscence to the beginning of the show. In fact, after reading the script, I went to my house and watched the entire first season. I needed to see the beginning of each arc and each decision that Arya was taking, because the big difference with the other seasons, is that there will be no loose ends.

In this CCXP interview, Maisie gave special attention to the beginning of each arc in her S1 story (noting different points of progression) and the decisions Arya ultimately makes.

For starters…

Arya begins S8 as the fighter she always wanted to be. So what elements in her S8 story arc creates that pressure on Arya to go against who she wants to be like it did in S1? Recall her line in S7, “The world doesn’t just let girls choose who we want to be.”

Arya’s strong bond with Jon. Descisions from all the way back in Winterfell when she broke the rules and kept Jon’s gift to her in Needle (without her parent’s permission) and later denies her father the truth when he asks her who gave her the sword. She would not betray Jon, not even for her father.

S1 didn’t have her No One/FM storyline. This is Arya through and through. Which tags nicely with Maisie’s recent comment about S8: seeing a lighter more fun Arya that we knew at the beginning of the series.

At the end of S1, Arya witnesses a family member die. In her own futile way, she tries to save them but is powerless to stop it from happening.

Arya is forcibly turned into Arry the orphan boy at the end of S1. Her hair shredded and cut off by Yoren while she cries and tries to stop him. Perhaps we may see something similar happen again? Remember she is a fighter and the warrior going into S8 but maybe that is not be her final state by the end of the season? Something pushing her to change who she wants to be. Bittersweet.

Maisie also revealed that Arya has goals in S8 that she has never had before. 🤔

The incident at the Trident. Choosing to protect an innocent smallfolk boy when attacked by someone highborn and royal. That descision has major consequences, she has to let Nymeria go and Lady dies in her place.

The descision to train with Syrio and his lessons which will come in handy during a war. Her descision to run and save her life and escaping the Red Keep the way she did.

Trying to save Ned even though it was pointless and she had no power to save him.

To become Arry, accepting this new identity that was forced upon her as her way to survive and make it back home.

Also, Maisie said right at the end of her recap interview that after LF’s death scene "they make a conscious decision to see a change in Arya.“  👀 It seems these changes will continue into S8.

tags: the house of black and white
summary:
“And who are you, child ?” 
“No one.” 
“A lie.” 
“How do you know ? Is it magic ?” 
“A man does not need to be a wizard to know...
text:
And who are you, child ?”
“No one.”
“A lie.”
“How do you know ? Is it magic ?”
“A man does not need to be a wizard to know truth from falsehood, not if he has eyes.
source: A Feast for Crows ; George R. R. Martin

reblog.comment: A Feast for Crows ; George R. R. Martin

blog.name: stray-arrows
blog.title: ☾ KING IN THE NORTH ☆
blog.description:
iss your ~problematic~ fave |  JON SNOW | CLERITH | CLOUD STRIFE | 
 JONERYS | 
MATT MURDOCK | SPACE |  karedevil | kastle | mattelektra | ben poindexter | RICK GRIMES | richonne | CARYL | ichiruki | sasusaku | GAME OF THRONES | aliens | synthwave | the walking dead (1-6) ♥

summary: omg when sansa tells arya she should be “on her knees” thanking her for “saving” winterfell when jon failed, i never wanted to...
body:
omg when sansa tells arya she should be “on her knees” thanking her for “saving” winterfell when jon failed, i never wanted to reach through a screen and slap a character more. 

and it gets worse when she’s like “the vale rode to war FOR ME” it’s like yeah. petyr sexually/romantically wanted you so he GAVE you his help. if petyr didn’t think he could get IT from sansa, the vale would have never been at her whim 

this is why it’s so incredibly frustrating when people say battle of the bastards was won because of sansa. it wasn’t. it was won because of petyr and jon. that’s it. that’s why jon is so pissed at petyr. he knows petyr is playing sansa and she’s letting him.

JON fought and bled in the mud of winterfell for his family, and sansa risked her brothers lives just so she could have winterfell to herself.

so happy the scripts to 7 validated all my frustrations.

summary: i like that arya’s good at sword fighting and all but i wish we could have actually seen her gain these skills. what she did in...
body: i like that arya’s good at sword fighting and all but i wish we could have actually seen her gain these skills. what she did in bravos doesnt explain how she got so good at sword fighting, and she only trained with  syrio for a few weeks and the hound only a few months.

reblog.comment: i like that arya’s good at sword fighting and all but i wish we could have actually seen her gain these skills. what she did in bravos doesnt explain how she got so good at sword fighting, and she only trained with  syrio for a few weeks and the hound only a few months.

summary: The Difference Between Us - SoHereWeAre - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: The Difference Between Us - SoHereWeAre - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 20/20
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, A Song of Ice and Fire & Related Fandoms
Rating: Explicit
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings

This has both parings: Arya/Jon and Arya/Gendry. Heed the tags! Jon/Arya is the main relationship. Not to be taken too seriously, this is just my little fantasy contribution.

blog.name: princessmissandei
blog.title: Night Wolf
blog.description: Marie | Slytherin | Writer About and Before You Follow Multi-fandom blog with an emphasis on ASOIAF and various period dramas. Very fond of canon Starks, Targaryens, Durrandons and Baratheons. Reylos do not engage.

summary: I don't understand why people focus so hard on Arya's relationship with Sansa and what they want it to be. Their dynamic is far...
body:
I don’t understand why people focus so hard on Arya’s relationship with Sansa and what they want it to be. Their dynamic is far from the most important for either character. Both of them have massively more important relationships with other characters than they do with each other. Arya loves/has more relationship development with Jon, Ned, Catelyn, Bran, Rickon, Syrio, Old Nan, Hodor, Mycah, Yoren, Gendry, Hot Pie, Weasel, Nymeria, Merry, Lanna, the Sailor’s wife, various sex workers, the Waif, the Kindly man, people in Braavos, Daena, her fellow actors, her co-workers/roommates than she does with Sansa.

Yes, Arya’s self-esteem issues are rooted in the bullying she canonically endures from Sansa, Jeyne Poole, and Septa Mordane and that’s significant to her character, but that doesn’t explain the hyperfocus on prioritizing and idealizing Arya’s relationship with her sister. The same doesn’t happen with her dynamics with Mordane or Jeyne, the latter of whom currently has a stronger connection to Arya since Jeyne is masquerading as her. So this emphasis on the empty *~*sisterhood*~* between the girls doesn’t make any sense.

summary: Maisie seems so happy for Arya‘s whole arc and ending... talking about how fun and light she is... and how she will have...
body: Maisie seems so happy for Arya‘s whole arc and ending… talking about how fun and light she is… and how she will have completely different goals… and that her arc in the last season shares a lot of parallels with her first season… whatever i‘m ready like i‘ve never been before gimme s8 and all that gendrya fluff

summary: Maisie: In my case, Arya has a development that has a lot of reminiscence at the beginning of the show. In fact, after reading...
body:
Maisie: In my case, Arya has a development that has a lot of reminiscence at the beginning of the show. In fact, after reading the script, I went to my house and watched the entire first season. I needed to see the beginning of each arc and each decision that Arya was taking, because the big difference with the other seasons, is that there will be no loose ends. [x]

im actually……………………dare i say it……….hyped by this?????? ok  im just throwing it out there: s1 for arya ended with her and gendry hitting the road together. IM JUST SAYING

blog.description: A devoted fan defending her precious cinnamon roll, its all you need to know!...and i love cheesecake...bye. Currently on hiatus.

summary: She pushed upon both doors at once with the flat of her gloved hands, but neither one would budge. Locked and barred.“Let me in,...
body:
She pushed upon both doors at once with the flat of her gloved hands, but neither one would budge. Locked and barred.“Let me in, you stupid,” she said. “I crossed the narrow sea.” She made a fist and pounded. “Jaqen told me to come. I have the iron coin.” She pulled it from her pouch and held it up. “See? Valar morghulis.”

I sometimes forget Arya is only 11, but then i get stuff like this. “Let me in, you stupid.” So freaking cute. My smol bean is too precious. 😂😍😍
